p:
Let us now compare the literature data with our predictions. The most common rotational angle between consecutive unmoved ( l = k = 0) BTA-centred monomers is 60–65° [ 44, 58, 62, 63, 64]. The calculations show that the binding energy corresponding to these coordinates is about −73 kJ mol −1 for the azo–BTA star (marked with yellow color). Interestingly, around
Ω
= 60° a local minimum on this symmetrical diagram is observed. Smaller rotational angles are also found in literature, for instance, 13–16° for the consecutive stars [ 40].
